data.content: Roger Federer is a professional tennis player from Switzerland. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest tennis players of all time. Federer has won a record 20 Grand Slam singles titles, including eight Wimbledon titles, six Australian Open titles, five US Open titles, and one French Open title. He has also held the world No. 1 ranking in men's singles tennis for a record 310 weeks, including a record 237 consecutive weeks. Federer is known for his elegant playing style, versatility, and sportsmanship, making him a beloved figure in the world of tennis.
How many Grand Slam titles did he have?
Roger Federer has won a record 20 Grand Slam titles.
